Curator's comments: Walker & Higgs 2001 Berenike II, Arsinoe's successor as queen of Egypt, was also honoured with several series of portrait coinage. The issues were not as large as those of Arsinoe, but were distinctive for their production on two different weight standards. Some gold and silver was produced, like these two examples, on the local Ptolemaic standard for use within the closed currency system of the kingdom. Others (see Walker & Higgs, cat. nos. 70-71) were produced on the Attic standard, evidently with a view to use abroad.
